content: Hey everyone! :wave: We've got our first Libs meeting in a while happening tomorrow(ish). @Jack Wrenn was going to talk through some safer transmute with us, so it might be worth having a quick read up on the RFC: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2981 :smile:
hi y'all! :wave: excited to answer your questions and share how the requirements-gathering phase informed this particular design!
Agenda: https://hackmd.io/hjoeW0qAQfqe8aclmoFpyA
is there a zoom link?
@boats Did we want to do Zoom? Or Zulip? Iâ€™m ok with either and can set up a link if we want to go that way
I don't have an opinion!
@Jack Wrenn Do you have a preference for video or text meetings?

Ooof, that's hard to say. If there's a lot of back-and-forth or Q&A, voice might be a bit smoother. In particular, voice makes it easier to pose incomplete questions, since we can iterate on figuring out exactly what the question is before trying to answer it.

If the questions are well-defined or code-heavy, text-chat has the distinct advantage.
(I suppose voice chat doesn't preclude also typing questions/answers?)
Iâ€™ll get a pot of tea on and set up a Zoom link for us ðŸ™‚
perfect!
Is there anything else we should try look at today? Any other RFCs or PRs or anything?
we could start with just the one thing for now perhaps
That's probably a good idea :smile: I can give us an update on where the project groups are at and then we can dive into safer transmute
Invite link: https://zoom.us/j/97058729336
Starting in twenty minutes-ish? Or am I misremembering?
Yep, 20 minutes-ish
Alrighty, I've got it all open now. Is anybody currently waiting?
cc @Amanieu
https://github.com/jswrenn/rfcs/blob/safer-transmute/text/0000-safer-transmute.md#minimal-useful-stabilization-surface
Thanks everyone for coming along! I've dropped the notes I took here: https://github.com/rust-lang/libs-team/blob/main/minutes/2020-10-14-meeting.md
